meanings.def: a small British coin and unit of money. There are 100 pence in one pound (£1).
examples: He had a few pennies in his pocket.
That will be 45 pence, please.
They cost 20p each.

meanings.def: a British coin in use until 1971. There were twelve pennies in one shilling and twenty shillings in a pound.

examples: The fee ranges from a few pennies to $30 or more.
We collected £700 and every penny went to charity.
She’s on a high salary but I’m sure she deserves every penny.

meanings.def: used to say that since you have started to do something, it is worth spending as much time or money as you need to in order to complete it

examples: It didn't cost a penny.
He has never paid me a penny.
She hasn’t got a penny to her name.

meanings.def: used to say that somebody has finally understood or realized something that they had not understood or realized before
examples: I had to explain the joke to her a couple of times before the penny dropped.

meanings.def: used to ask somebody what they are thinking about
to try to spend as little money as possible

examples: I bet that cost you a pretty penny.

meanings.def: people say ‘spend a penny’ to avoid saying ‘use the toilet’
to appear when they are not welcome or not wanted, especially when this happens regularly
very common and therefore not valuable
examples: Teachers of history are ten a penny.
We collected £700 and every penny went to charity.
She’s on a high salary but I’m sure she deserves every penny.
